itemDescription: Oriel Professor of the Philosophy of the Christian Religion

wikipedia_page.main: Clement Charles Julian Webb, FBA (1865–1954) was an English theologian and philosopher. He was Nolloth Professor of the Philosophy of the Christian Religion from 1920 to 1930.

response: *Clement Charles Julian Webb. (1920). The Doctrine of a Finite God. In God And Personality. London: George Allen & Unwin Ltd. pp. 134-155

link_mentions.page: List of English translations from medieval sources: A
response: *The devotions of Saint Anselm, Archbishop of Canterbury (1903).Anselm, S., Webb, C. Charles Julian. (1903). The devotions of Saint Anselm, Archbishop of Canterbury. London: Methuen. Includes Proslogium, selections from the meditations and prayers, and five letters. Edited by English theologian and philosopher Clement Charles Julian Webb (1865–1954).Webb, Clement Charles Julian (1865-1954). WorldCat Identities.
